name: Big Ray's Mexican Monkey Bread
author: bfr610
summary: I made this last night, and WOW it was delicious. I actually made it for a breakfast dish one time, and I think it's perfect for that as well.
ingredients: 1 (16.3 ounce) package refrigerated buttermilk biscuit dough, separated and each portion cut into quarters
1 ¼ cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
¾ cup jalapeno pepper slices, divided
¾ teaspoon dried parsley flakes, divided
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Prepare a 9x5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray
Pour melted butter into a small bowl
Dip each piece of biscuit dough in melted butter to coat
Arrange enough of the biscuit dough pieces in the bottom of the loaf pan to form a single layer; top with 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese, 1/4 cup pepper slices, and 1/4 teaspoon parsley
Repeat layering once and top with remaining biscuit dough pieces, pepper slices, and parsley flakes
Mix remaining 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese and mozzarella cheese together in a bowl; spread over the top of the ingredients to cover
Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes
Cool bread in pan for 5 minutes before inverting onto a plate to serve
